a.name: a
a.summary: The <a> SVG element creates a hyperlink to other web pages, files, locations in the same page, email addresses, or any other URL. It is very similar to HTML's a element.

href.name: href
href.summary: The `href` attribute defines a link to a resource as a reference URL. The exact meaning of that link depends on the context of each element using it.

target.name: target
target.summary: The `target` attribute should be used when there are multiple possible targets for the ending resource, such as when the parent document is embedded within an HTML or XHTML document, or is viewed with a tabbed browser. This attribute specifies the name of the browsing context (e.g., a browser tab or an (X)HTML iframe or object element) into which a document is to be opened when the link is activated.

xlink:href.name: xlink:href
xlink:href.summary: The `xlink:href` attribute defines a reference to a resource as a reference IRI. The exact meaning of that link depends on the context of each element using it.

altGlyph.name: altGlyph
altGlyph.summary: The `<altGlyph>` SVG element allows sophisticated selection of the glyphs used to render its child character data.

x.name: x
x.summary: The `x` attribute defines an x-axis coordinate in the user coordinate system.

y.name: y
y.summary: The `y` attribute defines a y-axis coordinate in the user coordinate system.

dx.name: dx
dx.summary: The `dx` attribute indicates a shift along the x-axis on the position of an element or its content.

dy.name: dy
dy.summary: The `dy` attribute indicates a shift along the y-axis on the position of an element or its content.

rotate.name: rotate
rotate.summary: The `rotate` attribute specifies how the animated element rotates as it travels along a path specified in an animateMotion element.

glyphRef.name: glyphRef
glyphRef.summary: The `glyphRef` attribute represents the glyph identifier, the format of which is dependent on the format of the given font.

format.name: format
format.summary: The `format` attribute indicates the format of the given font.

xlink:href.name: xlink:href
xlink:href.summary: The `xlink:href` attribute defines a reference to a resource as a reference IRI. The exact meaning of that link depends on the context of each element using it.

altGlyphDef.name: altGlyphDef
altGlyphDef.summary: The `<altGlyphDef>` SVG element defines a substitution representation for glyphs.

altGlyphItem.name: altGlyphItem
altGlyphItem.summary: The `<altGlyphItem>` element provides a set of candidates for glyph substitution by the altGlyph element.

animate.name: animate
animate.summary: The SVG `<animate>` element provides a way to animate an attribute of an element over time.

animateMotion.name: animateMotion
animateMotion.summary: The SVG `<animateMotion>` element provides a way to define how an element moves along a motion path.

keyPoints.name: keyPoints
keyPoints.summary: The `keyPoints` attribute indicates the simple duration of an animation.

path.name: path
path.summary: The `path` attribute has two different meanings, either it defines a text path along which the characters of a text are rendered, or a motion path along which a referenced element is animated.

rotate.name: rotate
rotate.summary: The `rotate` attribute specifies how the animated element rotates as it travels along a path specified in an animateMotion element.

animateTransform.name: animateTransform
animateTransform.summary: The `animateTransform` element animates a transformation attribute on its target element, thereby allowing animations to control translation, scaling, rotation, and/or skewing.

circle.name: circle
circle.summary: The `<circle>` SVG element is an SVG basic shape, used to draw circles based on a center point and a radius.

cx.name: cx
cx.summary: The `cx` attribute define the x-axis coordinate of a center point.

cy.name: cy
cy.summary: The `cy` attribute define the y-axis coordinate of a center point.

r.name: r
r.summary: The `r` attribute defines the radius of a circle.

pathLength.name: pathLength
pathLength.summary: The `pathLength` attribute lets authors specify a total length for the path, in user units. This value is then used to calibrate the browser's distance calculations with those of the author, by scaling all distance computations using the ratio `pathLength`/(computed value of path length).

clipPath.name: clipPath
clipPath.summary: The `<clipPath>` SVG element defines a clipping path, to be used by the clip-path property.

clipPathUnits.name: clipPathUnits
clipPathUnits.summary: The `clipPathUnits` attribute indicates which coordinate system to use for the contents of the clipPath element.

cursor.name: cursor
cursor.summary: Note: The CSS cursor property should be used instead of this element.

defs.name: defs
defs.summary: The `<defs>` element is used to store graphical objects that will be used at a later time. Objects created inside a `<defs>` element are not rendered directly. To display them you have to reference them (with a use element for example).

desc.name: desc
desc.summary: The `<desc>` element provides an accessible, long-text description of any SVG container element or graphics element.

discard.name: discard
discard.summary: The `<discard>` SVG element allows authors to specify the time at which particular elements are to be discarded, thereby reducing the resources required by an SVG user agent. This is particularly useful to help SVG viewers conserve memory while displaying long-running documents.

ellipse.name: ellipse
ellipse.summary: The `<ellipse>` element is an SVG basic shape, used to create ellipses based on a center coordinate, and both their x and y radius.

cx.name: cx
cx.summary: The `cx` attribute define the x-axis coordinate of a center point.

cy.name: cy
cy.summary: The `cy` attribute define the y-axis coordinate of a center point.

rx.name: rx
rx.summary: The `rx` attribute defines a radius on the x-axis.

ry.name: ry
ry.summary: The `ry` attribute defines a radius on the y-axis.

pathLength.name: pathLength
pathLength.summary: The `pathLength` attribute lets authors specify a total length for the path, in user units. This value is then used to calibrate the browser's distance calculations with those of the author, by scaling all distance computations using the ratio `pathLength`/(computed value of path length).

feBlend.name: feBlend
feBlend.summary: The `<feBlend>` SVG filter primitive composes two objects together ruled by a certain blending mode. This is similar to what is known from image editing software when blending two layers. The mode is defined by the mode attribute.

feColorMatrix.name: feColorMatrix
feColorMatrix.summary: The `<feColorMatrix>` SVG filter element changes colors based on a transformation matrix. Every pixel's color value `[R,G,B,A]` is matrix multiplied by a 5 by 5 color matrix to create new color `[R',G',B',A']`.

feComponentTransfer.name: feComponentTransfer
feComponentTransfer.summary: The `<feComponentTransfer>` SVG filter primitive performs color-component-wise remapping of data for each pixel. It allows operations like brightness adjustment, contrast adjustment, color balance or thresholding.

feComposite.name: feComposite
feComposite.summary: The `<feComposite>` SVG filter primitive performs the combination of two input images pixel-wise in image space using one of the Porter-Duff compositing operations: `over`, `in`, `atop`, `out`, `xor`, `lighter`, or `arithmetic`.

feConvolveMatrix.name: feConvolveMatrix
feConvolveMatrix.summary: The `<feConvolveMatrix>` SVG filter primitive applies a matrix convolution filter effect. A convolution combines pixels in the input image with neighboring pixels to produce a resulting image. A wide variety of imaging operations can be achieved through convolutions, including blurring, edge detection, sharpening, embossing and beveling.

feDiffuseLighting.name: feDiffuseLighting
feDiffuseLighting.summary: The `<feDiffuseLighting>` SVG filter primitive lights an image using the alpha channel as a bump map. The resulting image, which is an RGBA opaque image, depends on the light color, light position and surface geometry of the input bump map.

feDisplacementMap.name: feDisplacementMap
feDisplacementMap.summary: The `<feDisplacementMap>` SVG filter primitive uses the pixel values from the image from in2 to spatially displace the image from in.

feDistantLight.name: feDistantLight
feDistantLight.summary: The `<feDistantLight>` filter primitive defines a distant light source that can be used within a lighting filter primitive: feDiffuseLighting or feSpecularLighting.

feDropShadow.name: feDropShadow
feDropShadow.summary: The SVG `<feDropShadow>` filter primitive creates a drop shadow of the input image. It can only be used inside a element.

dx.name: dx
dx.summary: The `dx` attribute indicates a shift along the x-axis on the position of an element or its content.

dy.name: dy
dy.summary: The `dy` attribute indicates a shift along the y-axis on the position of an element or its content.

stdDeviation.name: stdDeviation
stdDeviation.summary: The `stdDeviation` attribute defines the standard deviation for the blur operation.

feFlood.name: feFlood
feFlood.summary: The `<feFlood>` SVG filter primitive fills the filter subregion with the color and opacity defined by flood-color and flood-opacity.

feFuncA.name: feFuncA
feFuncA.summary: The `<feFuncA>` SVG filter primitive defines the transfer function for the alpha component of the input graphic of its parent feComponentTransfer element.

feFuncB.name: feFuncB
feFuncB.summary: The `<feFuncB>` SVG filter primitive defines the transfer function for the blue component of the input graphic of its parent feComponentTransfer element.

feFuncG.name: feFuncG
feFuncG.summary: The `<feFuncG>` SVG filter primitive defines the transfer function for the green component of the input graphic of its parent feComponentTransfer element.

feFuncR.name: feFuncR
feFuncR.summary: The `<feFuncR>` SVG filter primitive defines the transfer function for the red component of the input graphic of its parent feComponentTransfer element.

feGaussianBlur.name: feGaussianBlur
feGaussianBlur.summary: The `<feGaussianBlur>` SVG filter primitive blurs the input image by the amount specified in stdDeviation, which defines the bell-curve.

feImage.name: feImage
feImage.summary: The `<feImage>` SVG filter primitive fetches image data from an external source and provides the pixel data as output (meaning if the external source is an SVG image, it is rasterized.)

feMerge.name: feMerge
feMerge.summary: The `<feMerge>` SVG element allows filter effects to be applied concurrently instead of sequentially. This is achieved by other filters storing their output via the result attribute and then accessing it in a feMergeNode child.

feMergeNode.name: feMergeNode
feMergeNode.summary: The `feMergeNode` takes the result of another filter to be processed by its parent feMerge.

feMorphology.name: feMorphology
feMorphology.summary: The `<feMorphology>` SVG filter primitive is used to erode or dilate the input image. Its usefulness lies especially in fattening or thinning effects.

feOffset.name: feOffset
feOffset.summary: The `<feOffset>` SVG filter primitive allows to offset the input image. The input image as a whole is offset by the values specified in the dx and dy attributes.

fePointLight.name: fePointLight
fePointLight.summary: The `<fePointLight>` filter primitive defines a light source which allows to create a point light effect. It that can be used within a lighting filter primitive: feDiffuseLighting or feSpecularLighting.

feSpecularLighting.name: feSpecularLighting
feSpecularLighting.summary: The `<feSpecularLighting>` SVG filter primitive lights a source graphic using the alpha channel as a bump map. The resulting image is an RGBA image based on the light color. The lighting calculation follows the standard specular component of the Phong lighting model. The resulting image depends on the light color, light position and surface geometry of the input bump map. The result of the lighting calculation is added. The filter primitive assumes that the viewer is at infinity in the z direction.

feSpotLight.name: feSpotLight
feSpotLight.summary: The `<feSpotLight>` SVG filter primitive defines a light source that can be used to create a spotlight effect. It is used within a lighting filter primitive: feDiffuseLighting or feSpecularLighting.

feTile.name: feTile
feTile.summary: The `<feTile>` SVG filter primitive allows to fill a target rectangle with a repeated, tiled pattern of an input image. The effect is similar to the one of a pattern.

feTurbulence.name: feTurbulence
feTurbulence.summary: The `<feTurbulence>` SVG filter primitive creates an image using the Perlin turbulence function. It allows the synthesis of artificial textures like clouds or marble. The resulting image will fill the entire filter primitive subregion.

filter.name: filter
filter.summary: The `<filter>` SVG element defines a custom filter effect by grouping atomic filter primitives. It is never rendered itself, but must be used by the filter attribute on SVG elements, or the filter CSS property for SVG/HTML elements.

font.name: font
font.summary: The `<font>` SVG element defines a font to be used for text layout.

font-face.name: font-face
font-face.summary: The `<font-face>` SVG element corresponds to the CSS @font-face rule. It defines a font's outer properties.

font-face-format.name: font-face-format
font-face-format.summary: The `<font-face-format>` SVG element describes the type of font referenced by its parent font-face-uri.

font-face-name.name: font-face-name
font-face-name.summary: The `<font-face-name>` element points to a locally installed copy of this font, identified by its name.

font-face-src.name: font-face-src
font-face-src.summary: The `<font-face-src>` SVG element corresponds to the @font-face/src descriptor in CSS @font-face rules. It serves as container for font-face-name, pointing to locally installed copies of this font, and font-face-uri, utilizing remotely defined fonts.

font-face-uri.name: font-face-uri
font-face-uri.summary: The `<font-face-uri>` SVG element points to a remote definition of the current font.

foreignObject.name: foreignObject
foreignObject.summary: The `<foreignObject>` SVG element includes elements from a different XML namespace. In the context of a browser, it is most likely (X)HTML.

height.name: height
height.summary: The `height` attribute defines the vertical length of an element in the user coordinate system.

width.name: width
width.summary: The `width` attribute defines the horizontal length of an element in the user coordinate system.

x.name: x
x.summary: The `x` attribute defines an x-axis coordinate in the user coordinate system.

y.name: y
y.summary: The `y` attribute defines a y-axis coordinate in the user coordinate system.

g.name: g
g.summary: The `<g>` SVG element is a container used to group other SVG elements.

glyph.name: glyph
glyph.summary: A `<glyph>` defines a single glyph in an SVG font.

glyphRef.name: glyphRef
glyphRef.summary: The `glyphRef` element provides a single possible glyph to the referencing altGlyph substitution.

hkern.name: hkern
hkern.summary: The `<hkern>` SVG element allows to fine-tweak the horizontal distance between two glyphs. This process is known as kerning.

image.name: image
image.summary: The `<image>` SVG element includes images inside SVG documents. It can display raster image files or other SVG files.

line.name: line
line.summary: The `<line>` element is an SVG basic shape used to create a line connecting two points.

x1.name: x1
x1.summary: The `x1` attribute is used to specify the first x-coordinate for drawing an SVG element that requires more than one coordinate. Elements that only need one coordinate use the x attribute instead.

x2.name: x2
x2.summary: The `x2` attribute is used to specify the second x-coordinate for drawing an SVG element that requires more than one coordinate. Elements that only need one coordinate use the x attribute instead.

y1.name: y1
y1.summary: The `y1` attribute is used to specify the first y-coordinate for drawing an SVG element that requires more than one coordinate. Elements that only need one coordinate use the y attribute instead.

y2.name: y2
y2.summary: The `y2` attribute is used to specify the second y-coordinate for drawing an SVG element that requires more than one coordinate. Elements that only need one coordinate use the y attribute instead.

pathLength.name: pathLength
pathLength.summary: The `pathLength` attribute lets authors specify a total length for the path, in user units. This value is then used to calibrate the browser's distance calculations with those of the author, by scaling all distance computations using the ratio `pathLength`/(computed value of path length).

linearGradient.name: linearGradient
linearGradient.summary: The `<linearGradient>` element lets authors define linear gradients to apply to other SVG elements.

gradientUnits.name: gradientUnits
gradientUnits.summary: The `gradientUnits` attribute defines the coordinate system used for attributes specified on the gradient elements.

gradientTransform.name: gradientTransform
gradientTransform.summary: The `gradientTransform` attribute contains the definition of an optional additional transformation from the gradient coordinate system onto the target coordinate system (i.e., userSpaceOnUse or objectBoundingBox). This allows for things such as skewing the gradient. This additional transformation matrix is post-multiplied to (i.e., inserted to the right of) any previously defined transformations, including the implicit transformation necessary to convert from object bounding box units to user space.

href.name: href
href.summary: The `href` attribute defines a link to a resource as a reference URL. The exact meaning of that link depends on the context of each element using it.

spreadMethod.name: spreadMethod
spreadMethod.summary: The `spreadMethod` attribute determines how a shape is filled beyond the defined edges of a gradient.

x1.name: x1
x1.summary: The `x1` attribute is used to specify the first x-coordinate for drawing an SVG element that requires more than one coordinate. Elements that only need one coordinate use the x attribute instead.

x2.name: x2
x2.summary: The `x2` attribute is used to specify the second x-coordinate for drawing an SVG element that requires more than one coordinate. Elements that only need one coordinate use the x attribute instead.

xlink:href.name: xlink:href
xlink:href.summary: The `xlink:href` attribute defines a reference to a resource as a reference IRI. The exact meaning of that link depends on the context of each element using it.

y1.name: y1
y1.summary: The `y1` attribute is used to specify the first y-coordinate for drawing an SVG element that requires more than one coordinate. Elements that only need one coordinate use the y attribute instead.

y2.name: y2
y2.summary: The `y2` attribute is used to specify the second y-coordinate for drawing an SVG element that requires more than one coordinate. Elements that only need one coordinate use the y attribute instead.

marker.name: marker
marker.summary: The `<marker>` element defines the graphic that is to be used for drawing arrowheads or polymarkers on a given path, line, polyline or polygon element.

markerHeight.name: markerHeight
markerHeight.summary: The `markerHeight` attribute represents the height of the viewport into which the marker is to be fitted when it is rendered according to the viewBox and preserveAspectRatio attributes.

markerUnits.name: markerUnits
markerUnits.summary: The `markerUnits` attribute defines the coordinate system for the markerWidth and markerHeight attributes and the contents of the marker.

markerWidth.name: markerWidth
markerWidth.summary: The `markerWidth` attribute represents the width of the viewport into which the marker is to be fitted when it is rendered according to the viewBox and preserveAspectRatio attributes.

orient.name: orient
orient.summary: The `orient` attribute indicates how a marker is rotated when it is placed at its position on the shape.

preserveAspectRatio.name: preserveAspectRatio
preserveAspectRatio.summary: The `preserveAspectRatio` attribute indicates how an element with a viewBox providing a given aspect ratio must fit into a viewport with a different aspect ratio.

refX.name: refX
refX.summary: The `refX` attribute defines the x coordinate of an element's reference point.

refY.name: refY
refY.summary: The `refY` attribute defines the y coordinate of an element's reference point.

viewBox.name: viewBox
viewBox.summary: The `viewBox` attribute defines the position and dimension, in user space, of an SVG viewport.

mask.name: mask
mask.summary: The `<mask>` element defines an alpha mask for compositing the current object into the background. A mask is used/referenced using the mask property.

height.name: height
height.summary: The `height` attribute defines the vertical length of an element in the user coordinate system.

maskContentUnits.name: maskContentUnits
maskContentUnits.summary: The `maskContentUnits` attribute indicates which coordinate system to use for the contents of the mask element.

maskUnits.name: maskUnits
maskUnits.summary: The `maskUnits` attribute indicates which coordinate system to use for the geometry properties of the mask element.

x.name: x
x.summary: The `x` attribute defines an x-axis coordinate in the user coordinate system.

y.name: y
y.summary: The `y` attribute defines a y-axis coordinate in the user coordinate system.

width.name: width
width.summary: The `width` attribute defines the horizontal length of an element in the user coordinate system.

metadata.name: metadata
metadata.summary: The `<metadata>` SVG element adds metadata to SVG content. Metadata is structured information about data. The contents of `<metadata>` should be elements from other XML namespace such as RDF, FOAF, etc.

missing-glyph.name: missing-glyph
missing-glyph.summary: The `<missing-glyph>` SVG element's content is rendered, if for a given character the font doesn't define an appropriate glyph.

mpath.name: mpath
mpath.summary: The `<mpath>` sub-element for the animateMotion element provides the ability to reference an external path element as the definition of a motion path.

path.name: path
path.summary: The `<path>` SVG element is the generic element to define a shape. All the basic shapes can be created with a path element.

d.name: d
d.summary: The `d` attribute defines a path to be drawn.

pathLength.name: pathLength
pathLength.summary: The `pathLength` attribute lets authors specify a total length for the path, in user units. This value is then used to calibrate the browser's distance calculations with those of the author, by scaling all distance computations using the ratio `pathLength`/(computed value of path length).

pattern.name: pattern
pattern.summary: The `<pattern>` element defines a graphics object which can be redrawn at repeated x- and y-coordinate intervals ("tiled") to cover an area.

height.name: height
height.summary: The `height` attribute defines the vertical length of an element in the user coordinate system.

href.name: href
href.summary: The `href` attribute defines a link to a resource as a reference URL. The exact meaning of that link depends on the context of each element using it.

patternContentUnits.name: patternContentUnits
patternContentUnits.summary: The `patternContentUnits` attribute indicates which coordinate system to use for the contents of the pattern element.

patternTransform.name: patternTransform
patternTransform.summary: The `patternTransform` attribute defines a list of transform definitions that are applied to a pattern tile.

patternUnits.name: patternUnits
patternUnits.summary: The `patternUnits` attribute indicates which coordinate system to use for the geometry properties of the pattern element.

preserveAspectRatio.name: preserveAspectRatio
preserveAspectRatio.summary: The `preserveAspectRatio` attribute indicates how an element with a viewBox providing a given aspect ratio must fit into a viewport with a different aspect ratio.

viewBox.name: viewBox
viewBox.summary: The `viewBox` attribute defines the position and dimension, in user space, of an SVG viewport.

width.name: width
width.summary: The `width` attribute defines the horizontal length of an element in the user coordinate system.

x.name: x
x.summary: The `x` attribute defines an x-axis coordinate in the user coordinate system.

xlink:href.name: xlink:href
xlink:href.summary: The `xlink:href` attribute defines a reference to a resource as a reference IRI. The exact meaning of that link depends on the context of each element using it.

y.name: y
y.summary: The `y` attribute defines a y-axis coordinate in the user coordinate system.

polygon.name: polygon
polygon.summary: The `<polygon>` element defines a closed shape consisting of a set of connected straight line segments. The last point is connected to the first point.

points.name: points
points.summary: The `points` attribute defines a list of points. Each point is defined by a pair of number representing a X and a Y coordinate in the user coordinate system. If the attribute contains an odd number of coordinates, the last one will be ignored.

pathLength.name: pathLength
pathLength.summary: The `pathLength` attribute lets authors specify a total length for the path, in user units. This value is then used to calibrate the browser's distance calculations with those of the author, by scaling all distance computations using the ratio `pathLength`/(computed value of path length).

polyline.name: polyline
polyline.summary: The `<polyline>` SVG element is an SVG basic shape that creates straight lines connecting several points. Typically a `polyline` is used to create open shapes as the last point doesn't have to be connected to the first point. For closed shapes see the polygon element.

points.name: points
points.summary: The `points` attribute defines a list of points. Each point is defined by a pair of number representing a X and a Y coordinate in the user coordinate system. If the attribute contains an odd number of coordinates, the last one will be ignored.

pathLength.name: pathLength
pathLength.summary: The `pathLength` attribute lets authors specify a total length for the path, in user units. This value is then used to calibrate the browser's distance calculations with those of the author, by scaling all distance computations using the ratio `pathLength`/(computed value of path length).

radialGradient.name: radialGradient
radialGradient.summary: The `<radialGradient>` element lets authors define radial gradients that can be applied to fill or stroke of graphical elements.

cx.name: cx
cx.summary: The `cx` attribute define the x-axis coordinate of a center point.

cy.name: cy
cy.summary: The `cy` attribute define the y-axis coordinate of a center point.

fr.name: fr
fr.summary: The `fr` attribute defines the radius of the focal point for the radial gradient.

fx.name: fx
fx.summary: The `fx` attribute defines the x-axis coordinate of the focal point for a radial gradient.

fy.name: fy
fy.summary: The `fy` attribute defines the y-axis coordinate of the focal point for a radial gradient.

gradientUnits.name: gradientUnits
gradientUnits.summary: The `gradientUnits` attribute defines the coordinate system used for attributes specified on the gradient elements.

gradientTransform.name: gradientTransform
gradientTransform.summary: The `gradientTransform` attribute contains the definition of an optional additional transformation from the gradient coordinate system onto the target coordinate system (i.e., userSpaceOnUse or objectBoundingBox). This allows for things such as skewing the gradient. This additional transformation matrix is post-multiplied to (i.e., inserted to the right of) any previously defined transformations, including the implicit transformation necessary to convert from object bounding box units to user space.

href.name: href
href.summary: The `href` attribute defines a link to a resource as a reference URL. The exact meaning of that link depends on the context of each element using it.

r.name: r
r.summary: The `r` attribute defines the radius of a circle.

spreadMethod.name: spreadMethod
spreadMethod.summary: The `spreadMethod` attribute determines how a shape is filled beyond the defined edges of a gradient.

xlink:href.name: xlink:href
xlink:href.summary: The `xlink:href` attribute defines a reference to a resource as a reference IRI. The exact meaning of that link depends on the context of each element using it.

rect.name: rect
rect.summary: The `<rect>` element is a basic SVG shape that draws rectangles, defined by their position, width, and height. The rectangles may have their corners rounded.

x.name: x
x.summary: The `x` attribute defines an x-axis coordinate in the user coordinate system.

y.name: y
y.summary: The `y` attribute defines a y-axis coordinate in the user coordinate system.

width.name: width
width.summary: The `width` attribute defines the horizontal length of an element in the user coordinate system.

height.name: height
height.summary: The `height` attribute defines the vertical length of an element in the user coordinate system.

rx.name: rx
rx.summary: The `rx` attribute defines a radius on the x-axis.

ry.name: ry
ry.summary: The `ry` attribute defines a radius on the y-axis.

pathLength.name: pathLength
pathLength.summary: The `pathLength` attribute lets authors specify a total length for the path, in user units. This value is then used to calibrate the browser's distance calculations with those of the author, by scaling all distance computations using the ratio `pathLength`/(computed value of path length).

script.name: script
script.summary: The SVG `script` element allows to add scripts to an SVG document.

href.name: href
href.summary: The `href` attribute defines a link to a resource as a reference URL. The exact meaning of that link depends on the context of each element using it.

type.name: type
type.summary: The `type` attribute is a generic attribute and it has different meaning based on the context in which it's used.

xlink:href.name: xlink:href
xlink:href.summary: The `xlink:href` attribute defines a reference to a resource as a reference IRI. The exact meaning of that link depends on the context of each element using it.

set.name: set
set.summary: The SVG `<set>` element provides a simple means of just setting the value of an attribute for a specified duration.

to.name: to
to.summary: The `to` attribute indicates the final value of the attribute that will be modified during the animation.

stop.name: stop
stop.summary: The SVG `<stop>` element defines a color and its position to use on a gradient. This element is always a child of a linearGradient or radialGradient element.

offset.name: offset
offset.summary: This attribute defines where the gradient stop is placed along the gradient vector.

stop-color.name: stop-color
stop-color.summary: The `stop-color` attribute indicates what color to use at a gradient stop.

stop-opacity.name: stop-opacity
stop-opacity.summary: The `stop-opacity` attribute defines the opacity of a given color gradient stop.

style.name: style
style.summary: The SVG `<style>` element allows style sheets to be embedded directly within SVG content.

type.name: type
type.summary: The `type` attribute is a generic attribute and it has different meaning based on the context in which it's used.

media.name: media
media.summary: The `media` attribute specifies a media query that must be matched for a style sheet to apply.

title.name: title
title.summary: This attribute the title of the style sheet which can be used to switch between alternate style sheets.

svg.name: svg
svg.summary: The `svg` element is a container that defines a new coordinate system and viewport. It is used as the outermost element of SVG documents, but it can also be used to embed an SVG fragment inside an SVG or HTML document.

baseProfile.name: baseProfile
baseProfile.summary: The `baseProfile` attribute describes the minimum SVG language profile that the author believes is necessary to correctly render the content. The attribute does not specify any processing restrictions; It can be considered metadata.

contentScriptType.name: contentScriptType
contentScriptType.summary: The `contentScriptType` attribute specifies the default scripting language for the given document fragment on the svg element.

contentStyleType.name: contentStyleType
contentStyleType.summary: The `contentStyleType` attribute specifies the style sheet language for the given document fragment on the svg element.

height.name: height
height.summary: The `height` attribute defines the vertical length of an element in the user coordinate system.

preserveAspectRatio.name: preserveAspectRatio
preserveAspectRatio.summary: The `preserveAspectRatio` attribute indicates how an element with a viewBox providing a given aspect ratio must fit into a viewport with a different aspect ratio.

version.name: version
version.summary: The `version` attribute is used to indicate what specification a SVG document conforms to. It is only allowed on the root svg element. It is purely advisory and has no influence on rendering or processing.

viewBox.name: viewBox
viewBox.summary: The `viewBox` attribute defines the position and dimension, in user space, of an SVG viewport.

width.name: width
width.summary: The `width` attribute defines the horizontal length of an element in the user coordinate system.

x.name: x
x.summary: The `x` attribute defines an x-axis coordinate in the user coordinate system.

y.name: y
y.summary: The `y` attribute defines a y-axis coordinate in the user coordinate system.

switch.name: switch
switch.summary: The `<switch>` SVG element evaluates any requiredFeatures, requiredExtensions and systemLanguage attributes on its direct child elements in order, and then renders the first child where these attributes evaluate to true.

symbol.name: symbol
symbol.summary: The `<symbol>` element is used to define graphical template objects which can be instantiated by a use element.

height.name: height
height.summary: The `height` attribute defines the vertical length of an element in the user coordinate system.

preserveAspectRatio.name: preserveAspectRatio
preserveAspectRatio.summary: The `preserveAspectRatio` attribute indicates how an element with a viewBox providing a given aspect ratio must fit into a viewport with a different aspect ratio.

refX.name: refX
refX.summary: The `refX` attribute defines the x coordinate of an element's reference point.

refY.name: refY
refY.summary: The `refY` attribute defines the y coordinate of an element's reference point.

viewBox.name: viewBox
viewBox.summary: The `viewBox` attribute defines the position and dimension, in user space, of an SVG viewport.

width.name: width
width.summary: The `width` attribute defines the horizontal length of an element in the user coordinate system.

x.name: x
x.summary: The `x` attribute defines an x-axis coordinate in the user coordinate system.

y.name: y
y.summary: The `y` attribute defines a y-axis coordinate in the user coordinate system.

text.name: text
text.summary: The SVG `<text>` element draws a graphics element consisting of text. It's possible to apply a gradient, pattern, clipping path, mask, or filter to `<text>`, like any other SVG graphics element.

x.name: x
x.summary: The `x` attribute defines an x-axis coordinate in the user coordinate system.

y.name: y
y.summary: The `y` attribute defines a y-axis coordinate in the user coordinate system.

dx.name: dx
dx.summary: The `dx` attribute indicates a shift along the x-axis on the position of an element or its content.

dy.name: dy
dy.summary: The `dy` attribute indicates a shift along the y-axis on the position of an element or its content.

rotate.name: rotate
rotate.summary: The `rotate` attribute specifies how the animated element rotates as it travels along a path specified in an animateMotion element.

lengthAdjust.name: lengthAdjust
lengthAdjust.summary: The lengthAdjust attribute controls how the text is stretched into the length defined by the textLength attribute.

textLength.name: textLength
textLength.summary: The `textLength` attribute, available on SVG text and tspan elements, lets you specify the width of the space into which the text will draw. The user agent will ensure that the text does not extend farther than that distance, using the method or methods specified by the lengthAdjust attribute. By default, only the spacing between characters is adjusted, but the glyph size can also be adjusted if you change `lengthAdjust`.

textPath.name: textPath
textPath.summary: To render text along the shape of a path, enclose the text in a `<textPath>` element that has an href attribute with a reference to the path element.

href.name: href
href.summary: The `href` attribute defines a link to a resource as a reference URL. The exact meaning of that link depends on the context of each element using it.

lengthAdjust.name: lengthAdjust
lengthAdjust.summary: The lengthAdjust attribute controls how the text is stretched into the length defined by the textLength attribute.

method.name: method
method.summary: The `method` attribute indicates the method by which text should be rendered along the path of a textPath element.

path.name: path
path.summary: The `path` attribute has two different meanings, either it defines a text path along which the characters of a text are rendered, or a motion path along which a referenced element is animated.

side.name: side
side.summary: The `side` attribute determines the side of a path the text is placed on (relative to the path direction).

spacing.name: spacing
spacing.summary: The `spacing` attribute indicates how the user agent should determine the spacing between typographic characters that are to be rendered along a path.

startOffset.name: startOffset
startOffset.summary: The `startOffset` attribute defines an offset from the start of the path for the initial current text position along the path after converting the path to the textPath element's coordinate system.

textLength.name: textLength
textLength.summary: The `textLength` attribute, available on SVG text and tspan elements, lets you specify the width of the space into which the text will draw. The user agent will ensure that the text does not extend farther than that distance, using the method or methods specified by the lengthAdjust attribute. By default, only the spacing between characters is adjusted, but the glyph size can also be adjusted if you change `lengthAdjust`.

title.name: title
title.summary: The `<title>` element provides an accessible, short-text description of any SVG container element or graphics element.

tref.name: tref
tref.summary: The textual content for a text SVG element can be either character data directly embedded within the text element or the character data content of a referenced element, where the referencing is specified with a `<tref>` element.

tspan.name: tspan
tspan.summary: The SVG `<tspan>` element defines a subtext within a element or another `<tspan>` element. It allows for adjustment of the style and/or position of that subtext as needed.

x.name: x
x.summary: The `x` attribute defines an x-axis coordinate in the user coordinate system.

y.name: y
y.summary: The `y` attribute defines a y-axis coordinate in the user coordinate system.

dx.name: dx
dx.summary: The `dx` attribute indicates a shift along the x-axis on the position of an element or its content.

dy.name: dy
dy.summary: The `dy` attribute indicates a shift along the y-axis on the position of an element or its content.

rotate.name: rotate
rotate.summary: The `rotate` attribute specifies how the animated element rotates as it travels along a path specified in an animateMotion element.

lengthAdjust.name: lengthAdjust
lengthAdjust.summary: The lengthAdjust attribute controls how the text is stretched into the length defined by the textLength attribute.

textLength.name: textLength
textLength.summary: The `textLength` attribute, available on SVG text and tspan elements, lets you specify the width of the space into which the text will draw. The user agent will ensure that the text does not extend farther than that distance, using the method or methods specified by the lengthAdjust attribute. By default, only the spacing between characters is adjusted, but the glyph size can also be adjusted if you change `lengthAdjust`.

use.name: use
use.summary: The `<use>` element takes nodes from within the SVG document, and duplicates them somewhere else.

href.name: href
href.summary: The `href` attribute defines a link to a resource as a reference URL. The exact meaning of that link depends on the context of each element using it.

xlink:href.name: xlink:href
xlink:href.summary: The `xlink:href` attribute defines a reference to a resource as a reference IRI. The exact meaning of that link depends on the context of each element using it.

x.name: x
x.summary: The `x` attribute defines an x-axis coordinate in the user coordinate system.

y.name: y
y.summary: The `y` attribute defines a y-axis coordinate in the user coordinate system.

width.name: width
width.summary: The `width` attribute defines the horizontal length of an element in the user coordinate system.

height.name: height
height.summary: The `height` attribute defines the vertical length of an element in the user coordinate system.

view.name: view
view.summary: A view is a defined way to view the image, like a zoom level or a detail view.

vkern.name: vkern
vkern.summary: The `<vkern>` SVG element allows to fine-tweak the vertical distance between two glyphs in top-to-bottom fonts. This process is known as kerning.
